posts.name:
Evan Weber
Evan Weber
posts.content: Happy MLK day! What a great time to reflect on our country. I always think about how non-diverse the digital marketing industry is. If all of your employees are white, then you might have a diversity issue.

comments.commentText:
Other than the gender split, it is my experience that our industry is very much diverse, Evan, I have met and have friends from every country, every color and every size there is, all working in affiliate marketing.

My main beef is the gender split and even then, nowadays it has come a LONG way from what it was when I started.

I wonder if this is an issue just for American companies? what do you think? Am I wearing my European color glasses?
How many African-American connections do you have, what percentage?

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely! Diversity drives creativity and innovation. Lets strive for a more inclusive digital marketing landscape together. #DiversityMatters

posts.name:
Sonia Hunt
Sonia Hunt
posts.content:
That's a wrap for the 43rd Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference!

8000 of the best minds in healthcare gathered for connection, conversations and to share insights on innovation in health care.

New friendships were made, old friendships were celebrated.

𝗦𝗼𝗺𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 𝘄𝗲 𝗵𝗮𝗱:

-“Women are not little men.” ~, Founder @Springboard Enterprises

-GLP-1 is underestimated. Trump may help lower cost for access. This may be the year that people really appreciate how important GLP-1 is to the healthcare system.

-AI needs to be targeted to figure out where it can help. Its not about boiling the ocean; its about where the nuanced use cases where AI can be impactful due to its expense and resource intensive nature.

-Clinical research not included women until 1993. How can we gather the data we need moving forward?

-Know me, care for me, ease my way is what women want to see in healthcare.

𝗜 𝘀𝗲𝗲 𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗼𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗶𝗻:

-Longevity
-Women's Health
-Funding for Women's businesses
-Understanding value systems around AI
-How the Payor/Payee Relationship improves
-Startup ecosystem getting to sustainable success

A big thanks to the following people and companies for hosting incredible events:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, and countless others!

If we didn't meet up, I hope we do next year or sooner!

comments.commentText: James A. Felts You're behind if your organization doesn't prioritize health within it. But I'll also say that even though these are innovative organizations within health care, not all prioritize it within and they need to (if that makes sense?)
Sounds like you ticked all the boxes..

posts.commentAdded: What an inspiring conference! Excited to see how these insights will drive innovation in healthcare, especially for womens health and AI!

posts.name:
Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor
Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor
posts.content:
𝗗𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀𝗻’𝘁 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗲 𝗿𝗶𝗴𝗶𝗱 𝗼𝗿 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝘀𝗵.

The best leaders understand that strength and kindness can go hand in hand. By cultivating self-compassionate discipline, you can guide yourself—and others—with clarity, care, and confidence.

𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝗿𝗲 7 𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗽𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗮𝗰𝗵:
1️⃣ Notice Without Judging
Mistakes are opportunities to learn, not reasons for shame.
Growth starts with self-awareness.

2️⃣ Uncover the Root of Procrastination
What’s holding you back—a fear, a doubt, or a deeper need?
Addressing the “why” behind procrastination paves the way for lasting change.

3️⃣ Hold Yourself Gently Accountable
Ditch the self-criticism and ask, “What support do I need to move forward?” Approach yourself with curiosity, not judgment.

4️⃣ Affirm Your Worth Beyond Productivity
You are more than your accomplishments.
Celebrate small wins and remind yourself that your value isn’t tied to your output.

5️⃣ Break Big Goals into Bite-Sized Steps
Overwhelm is the enemy of progress.
Simplify large tasks into small, manageable actions to build momentum.

6️⃣ Pause to Reflect and Realign
Regularly check in with yourself.
How are you feeling? Are you on track? Reflection helps you adjust with intention.

7️⃣ Celebrate Progress, Not Perfection
Every step forward counts.
Focus on how far you’ve come instead of striving for flawlessness.

Self-compassionate discipline transforms not just how you lead, but also how you grow.

P.S. Which of these steps speaks to you the most?
Let’s explore it together in the comments.

️ Share if you agree.

️ And followfor more.

comments.commentText: How do you balance strength and kindness in your leadership?
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely love this approach! Self-compassionate discipline truly fosters growth. Step 4 resonates with me—celebrating small wins is key! 🎉

Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
posts.content:
Staying in the "wrong room" could cost you opportunities and growth.

People often seek comfort over challenge.

They’d rather lead a room than learn in one.

But...

Influence comes from surrounding yourself with sharper minds.

How often have you plateaued because you stayed where you felt safe?

Growth demands courage.

It’s not about being the smartest.

It’s about being smart enough to choose the right company.

⭣⭣⭣

 I’m

⤷ Hit “Follow” for daily insights.
⤷ I write about marketing, business, and growth topics daily.

comments.commentText:
Absolutely! 
The right company can elevate your thinking, spark new ideas, and push you to grow beyond what you thought was possible. 
It’s about being around those who challenge you to be better, not just comfortable. Choose your circle wisely!
Powerful reminder! True growth happens when we step out of our comfort zones and surround ourselves with people who challenge and inspire us. Being in the 'right room' is key to leveling up.

posts.commentAdded: Great reminder! Embracing discomfort opens doors to growth and fresh perspectives. Lets challenge ourselves to step into new rooms! 🚀

posts.name:
Kevin William
Kevin William
posts.content:
AI and Leadership: Embrace the Future, Don’t Fear It
In a recent discussion I had with a leader of an organisation, the topic of AI came up. The interesting part of the conversation was the intentional refusal to admit the reality: AI is already here, and it is just going to get better!

From my personal experience, leaders often see AI as a disruptor, but the truth is, it is an enabler. A powerful tool to drive efficiency, creativity, and growth. The question is no longer, "Should we adopt AI?" but rather, "How can we lead the change effectively?" 

Here’s why leaders must prioritize AI integration:
1️⃣ Enhanced Decision-Making: AI analyzes data faster and more accurately, offering insights that can revolutionize strategies and outcomes.
2️⃣ Improved Productivity: Automation of repetitive tasks frees teams to focus on innovation and creativity.
3️⃣ Staying Competitive: Organizations that delay adopting AI risk falling behind competitors who leverage its potential.
4️⃣ Unlocking Human Potential: By taking over routine work, AI allows employees to focus on what truly matters: creativity, problem-solving, and building relationships.

The key thing to understand here is that AI is not here to replace leaders or employees; it is here to amplify their strengths.

This is a call to action to all leaders: If the goal is to stay relevant in a rapidly changing market, then embracing AI is a MUST and not a luxury!

comments.commentText: The point about unlocking human potential really strikes a chord. When we think about AI, we often focus on what it can do for businesses—efficiency, cost savings, and automation. But what about what it can do for people? By taking repetitive tasks off our plates, AI allows us to tap into creativity, innovation, and emotional intelligence. It is a shift from doing to thinking, from reacting to creating. Leaders who understand this will not just adopt AI—they will redefine the workplace for the better.

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Embracing AI is essential for leaders to drive innovation and empower their teams to thrive in a competitive landscape.
